Safe HaskellSafe

BinTree.Internal

Description

Module name: Bintree.Internal Description: our own Haskell implementation of a Binary Search Trees, provides basic (common) features of BinTree and AVLTree.

Synopsis

  • data BinTree a
    • = EmptyBT
    • | BTNode a (BinTree a) (BinTree a)
  • height :: (Num b, Ord b) => BinTree a -> b
  • left :: BinTree a -> BinTree a
  • right :: BinTree a -> BinTree a
  • value :: Num a => BinTree a -> a
  • getValue :: Maybe a -> a
  • search :: (Num a, Ord a) => a -> BinTree a -> Bool
  • inorder :: BinTree a -> [a]
  • postorder :: BinTree a -> [a]
  • preorder :: BinTree a -> [a]
  • ifEqBinTrees :: Eq a => BinTree a -> BinTree a -> Bool

height :: (Num b, Ord b) => BinTree a -> b Source #

Returns height of the tree.

left :: BinTree a -> BinTree a Source #

Returns value of node's left son.

right :: BinTree a -> BinTree a Source #

Returns value of node's right son.

value :: Num a => BinTree a -> a Source #

Returns node's value (assuming that empty BinTree has no value!)

getValue :: Maybe a -> a Source #

Gets node's value (attempt to get value of empty BinTree calls an error).

search :: (Num a, Ord a) => a -> BinTree a -> Bool Source #

Checks if a given value exists in a BinTree.

inorder :: BinTree a -> [a] Source #

Performs an inorder conversion to simple list, for example: inorder BTNode 4 (BTNode 2 (BTNode 1 EmptyBT EmptyBT) (BTNode 3 EmptyBT EmptyBT)) (BTNode 5 EmptyBT (BTNode 6 EmptyBT (BTNode 7 EmptyBT EmptyBT))) => [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]

postorder :: BinTree a -> [a] Source #

Performs a postorder conversion to simple list, for example: postorder BTNode 4 (BTNode 2 (BTNode 1 EmptyBT EmptyBT) (BTNode 3 EmptyBT EmptyBT)) (BTNode 5 EmptyBT (BTNode 6 EmptyBT (BTNode 7 EmptyBT EmptyBT))) => [1, 3, 2, 7, 6, 5, 4]

preorder :: BinTree a -> [a] Source #

Performs a preorder conversion to simple list, for example: preorder BTNode 4 (BTNode 2 (BTNode 1 EmptyBT EmptyBT) (BTNode 3 EmptyBT EmptyBT)) (BTNode 5 EmptyBT (BTNode 6 EmptyBT (BTNode 7 EmptyBT EmptyBT))) => [4, 2, 1, 3, 5, 6, 7]

ifEqBinTrees :: Eq a => BinTree a -> BinTree a -> Bool Source #

Checks if two BinTrees are equal, which means that they contain the same values.
